Events.html: 46 BCE – Julius Caesar defeats Titus Labienus in the Battle of Ruspina.
Events.text: Julius Caesar defeats Titus Labienus in the Battle of Ruspina.

Events.html: 871 – Battle of Reading: Æthelred of Wessex fights, and is defeated by, a Danish invasion army.
Events.text: Battle of Reading: Æthelred of Wessex fights, and is defeated by, a Danish invasion army.

Events.html: 1490 – Anne of Brittany announces that all those who would ally with the King of France will be considered guilty of the crime of lèse-majesté.
Events.text: Anne of Brittany announces that all those who would ally with the King of France will be considered guilty of the crime of lèse-majesté.

Events.html: 1642 – King Charles I of England sends soldiers to arrest members of Parliament, commencing England's slide into civil war.
Events.text: King Charles I of England sends soldiers to arrest members of Parliament, commencing England's slide into civil war.

Events.html: 1649 – English Civil War: The Rump Parliament votes to put Charles I on trial.
Events.text: English Civil War: The Rump Parliament votes to put Charles I on trial.

Events.html: 1717 – The Netherlands, Great Britain, and France sign the Triple Alliance.
Events.text: The Netherlands, Great Britain, and France sign the Triple Alliance.

Events.html: 1762 – Great Britain declares war on Spain and Naples.
Events.text: Great Britain declares war on Spain and Naples.

Events.html: 1798 – Constantine Hangerli arrives in Bucharest, Wallachia, as its new Prince, invested by the Ottoman Empire.
Events.text: Constantine Hangerli arrives in Bucharest, Wallachia, as its new Prince, invested by the Ottoman Empire.

Events.html: 1847 – Samuel Colt sells his first revolver pistol to the United States government.
Events.text: Samuel Colt sells his first revolver pistol to the United States government.

Events.html: 1854 – The McDonald Islands are discovered by Captain William McDonald aboard the Samarang.
Events.text: The McDonald Islands are discovered by Captain William McDonald aboard the Samarang.

Events.html: 1863 – The New Apostolic Church, a Christian and chiliastic church, is established in Hamburg, Germany.
Events.text: The New Apostolic Church, a Christian and chiliastic church, is established in Hamburg, Germany.

Events.html: 1865 – The New York Stock Exchange opens its first permanent headquarters at 10-12 Broad near Wall Street in New York City.
Events.text: The New York Stock Exchange opens its first permanent headquarters at 10-12 Broad near Wall Street in New York City.

Events.html: 1878 – Sofia is emancipated from Ottoman rule.
Events.text: Sofia is emancipated from Ottoman rule.

Events.html: 1884 – The Fabian Society is founded in London, England, United Kingdom.
Events.text: The Fabian Society is founded in London, England, United Kingdom.

Events.html: 1889 – The Oklahoma Land Run opens 2 million acres of unused Oklahoma Territory to first serve first come settlers on April 22.
Events.text: The Oklahoma Land Run opens 2 million acres of unused Oklahoma Territory to first serve first come settlers on April 22.

Events.html: 1896 – Utah is admitted as the 45th U.S. state.
Events.text: Utah is admitted as the 45th U.S. state.

Events.html: 1903 – Topsy, an elephant, is electrocuted by the owners of Luna Park, Coney Island. Thomas Edison's movie company shoots the film Electrocuting an Elephant of the execution.
Events.text: Topsy, an elephant, is electrocuted by the owners of Luna Park, Coney Island. Thomas Edison's movie company shoots the film Electrocuting an Elephant of the execution.

Events.html: 1912 – The Scout Association is incorporated throughout the British Empire by royal charter.
Events.text: The Scout Association is incorporated throughout the British Empire by royal charter.

Events.html: 1944 – World War II: Operation Carpetbagger, involving the dropping of arms and supplies to resistance fighters in Europe, begins.
Events.text: World War II: Operation Carpetbagger, involving the dropping of arms and supplies to resistance fighters in Europe, begins.

Events.html: 1948 – Burma gains its independence from the United Kingdom.
Events.text: Burma gains its independence from the United Kingdom.

Events.html: 1951 – Korean War: Chinese and North Korean forces capture Seoul.
Events.text: Korean War: Chinese and North Korean forces capture Seoul.

Events.html: 1955 – The Greek National Radical Union is formed by Konstantinos Karamanlis.
Events.text: The Greek National Radical Union is formed by Konstantinos Karamanlis.

Events.html: 1958 – Sputnik 1 falls to Earth from orbit.
Events.text: Sputnik 1 falls to Earth from orbit.

Events.html: 1959 – Luna 1 becomes the first spacecraft to reach the vicinity of the Moon.
Events.text: Luna 1 becomes the first spacecraft to reach the vicinity of the Moon.

Events.html: 1965 – United States President Lyndon B. Johnson proclaims his "Great Society" during his State of the Union address.
Events.text: United States President Lyndon B. Johnson proclaims his "Great Society" during his State of the Union address.

Events.html: 1966 – A military coup takes place in Upper Volta (later Burkina Faso), dissolving the National Parliament and leading to a new national constitution.
Events.text: A military coup takes place in Upper Volta (later Burkina Faso), dissolving the National Parliament and leading to a new national constitution.

Events.html: 1970 – A magnitude 7.7 earthquake strikes Tonghai County, China, killing at least 15,000 people.
Events.text: A magnitude 7.7 earthquake strikes Tonghai County, China, killing at least 15,000 people.

Events.html: 1972 – Rose Heilbron becomes the first female judge to sit at the Old Bailey in London, England.
Events.text: Rose Heilbron becomes the first female judge to sit at the Old Bailey in London, England.

Events.html: 1974 – United States President Richard Nixon refuses to hand over materials subpoenaed by the Senate Watergate Committee.
Events.text: United States President Richard Nixon refuses to hand over materials subpoenaed by the Senate Watergate Committee.

Events.html: 1976 – The Troubles: The Ulster Volunteer Force shoots dead six Irish Catholic civilians in County Armagh, Northern Ireland. The next day, gunmen shoot dead ten Protestant civilians nearby in retaliation.
Events.text: The Troubles: The Ulster Volunteer Force shoots dead six Irish Catholic civilians in County Armagh, Northern Ireland. The next day, gunmen shoot dead ten Protestant civilians nearby in retaliation.

links.subject: shoots dead six Irish Catholic civilians
links.title: Reavey and O'Dowd killings

Events.html: 1987 – The 1987 Maryland train collision: An Amtrak train en route to Boston from Washington, D.C., collides with Conrail engines in Chase, Maryland, killing 16 people.
Events.text: The 1987 Maryland train collision: An Amtrak train en route to Boston from Washington, D.C., collides with Conrail engines in Chase, Maryland, killing 16 people.

Events.html: 1989 – Second Gulf of Sidra incident: a pair of Libyan MiG-23 "Floggers" are shot down by a pair of US Navy F-14 Tomcats during an air-to-air confrontation.
Events.text: Second Gulf of Sidra incident: a pair of Libyan MiG-23 "Floggers" are shot down by a pair of US Navy F-14 Tomcats during an air-to-air confrontation.

Events.html: 1990 – In Pakistan's deadliest train accident an overloaded passenger train collides with an empty freight train, resulting in 307 deaths and 700 injuries.
Events.text: In Pakistan's deadliest train accident an overloaded passenger train collides with an empty freight train, resulting in 307 deaths and 700 injuries.

links.subject: collides with an empty freight train
links.title: Sukkur rail disaster

Events.html: 1998 – Wilaya of Relizane massacres in Algeria: over 170 are killed in three remote villages.
Events.text: Wilaya of Relizane massacres in Algeria: over 170 are killed in three remote villages.

links.subject: Wilaya of Relizane massacres
links.title: Wilaya of Relizane massacres of 4 January 1998

Events.html: 1998 – A massive ice storm hits eastern Canada and the northeastern United States, continuing through January 10 and causing widespread destruction.
Events.text: A massive ice storm hits eastern Canada and the northeastern United States, continuing through January 10 and causing widespread destruction.

Events.html: 1999 – Former professional wrestler Jesse Ventura is sworn in as governor of Minnesota.
Events.text: Former professional wrestler Jesse Ventura is sworn in as governor of Minnesota.

Events.html: 2000 – Two trains on the Røros Line collide in Åsta, Norway, resulting in an explosive fire and 19 deaths.
Events.text: Two trains on the Røros Line collide in Åsta, Norway, resulting in an explosive fire and 19 deaths.

Events.html: 2004 – Spirit, a NASA Mars rover, lands successfully on Mars at 04:35 UTC.
Events.text: Spirit, a NASA Mars rover, lands successfully on Mars at 04:35 UTC.

Events.html: 2004 – Mikheil Saakashvili is elected President of Georgia following the November 2003 Rose Revolution.
Events.text: Mikheil Saakashvili is elected President of Georgia following the November 2003 Rose Revolution.

Events.html: 2006 – Prime Minister Ariel Sharon of Israel suffers a second, apparently more serious stroke. His authority is transferred to acting Prime Minister Ehud Olmert.
Events.text: Prime Minister Ariel Sharon of Israel suffers a second, apparently more serious stroke. His authority is transferred to acting Prime Minister Ehud Olmert.

Events.html: 2007 – The 110th United States Congress convenes, electing Nancy Pelosi as the first female Speaker of the House in U.S. history.
Events.text: The 110th United States Congress convenes, electing Nancy Pelosi as the first female Speaker of the House in U.S. history.

links.subject: Speaker of the House
links.title: Speaker of the United States House of Representatives

Events.html: 2010 – Burj Khalifa, the world's tallest building, is officially opened.
Events.text: Burj Khalifa, the world's tallest building, is officially opened.

Events.html: 2013 – A gunman kills eight people in a house-to-house rampage in Kawit, the Philippines.
Events.text: A gunman kills eight people in a house-to-house rampage in Kawit, the Philippines.
